item.title: MapM
item.description: How to understand the following computation result? item.title: A Really Trivial Monad
item.description: Generally some people saying that Monad is a computation that take a ‘world’ as parameter and produce a result along with modified ‘world’. And this a manner that doing impure in a pure language. While thinking in terms of Parser, it means taking a String and produce a result along with the rest of the string which is not parsed1. Consequently, we think a monadic type in Haskell is just a function.
